definition: engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Although this for me is a hitting pain, I am willing to chew it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 虽然于我是铭心刻骨的痛，我却愿意细细品尝。

sentences.english: Love becomes memorial because its bitter taste.
sentences.chinese: 爱受了些苦，才变得铭心刻骨。

sentences.english: Love a person attitude, how to deep-rooted.
sentences.chinese: 爱一个人的态度，如何铭心刻骨。

definition: lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
in love with/to feel deeply attached to
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
lit. to feel as if one's intestines have been cut short/broken-hearted (idiom)
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
(of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
